sections.heading: Overview
content:
Roy E. Reese, PhD, is a senior fellow in the Division of Violence
Prevention at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), where
he is involved in several national initiatives focusing on school-community
partnerships for the prevention of youth and family violence. Prior to joining
the CDC, Reese spent several years as a professor of psychology and black
studies, co-directing a team conducting school- and community-based prevention
research in Chicago.

A clinical child psychologist by training, Reese has focused his research on
the prevention of health-compromising behavior among children, adolescents, and
their families in under-resourced communities, as well as the promotion of
wellness and broad-based social and behavioral competencies.
